prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with Central Hole** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The object has a central hole that runs through its length. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.05, 0.0] The first sketch for this part consists of two circular loops that represent the top and bottom faces of the cylindrical object. The circles have the following specifications: - Loop 1: Center=[0.375, 0.375], Radius=0.375 - Loop 2: Center=[0.375, 0.375], Radius=0.2917 After creating the sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.75 using the `sketch_scale` parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified euler angles and translation vector. The second sketch for this part consists of a single circular loop that will create the central hole in the cylindrical object. The circle has the following specifications: - Center=[0.15, 0.0418], Radius=0.0167 After creating the second sketch, extrude it by a depth of 0.4167 both towards and opposite to the normal direction. Apply the cut boolean operation on the resulting 3D model with the first sketch. The part dimension details are as follows: - Height: 0.75 * 0.75 = 0.5625 units - Width: 0.05 units - Length: 0.75 units **Part 2: Tall Cylindrical Structure with Horizontal Ridges** Construct a tall, cylindrical structure with a series of horizontal ridges. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2917, 0.05, 0.6656] This part consists of three faces with several arcs and lines that describe three circular segments and three straight line segments. Faces specifications: **Face 1:** Loop 1: - Arc 1: Start Point=[0.0583, 0.0], Mid Point=[0.0833, 0.0011], End Point=[0.1083, 0.0] - Line 1: Start Point=[0.1083, 0.0], End Point=[0.1083, 0.0836] - Arc 2: Start Point=[0.1083, 0.0836], Mid Point=[0.0833, 0.0844], End Point=[0.0583, 0.0836] - Line 2: Start Point=[0.0583, 0.0836], End Point=[0.0583, 0.0] **Face 2:** Loop 1: - Center=[0.0167, 0.0418], Radius=0.0167 After creating the sketches, transform the 2D sketches into 3D sketches taking into account the specified euler angles and translation vector. Extrude two parts of them with a depth of 0.1667 in the direction and opposite direction of the normals, and the last one with a depth of 0.4167 in the opposite direction of the normals. The height, width, and length of this last part are as follows: - Height: 0.1667 units - Width: 0.8333 units - Length: 0.1667 units The existing body should then have the 'JoinFeatureOperation' applied to the parts resulting from the extrusions to form the desired tall, cylindrical structure.</description>
